free_txt: Subents 2 and 3 were taken from EXFOR 21807
and were translated to this entry because of new
results on Ni-58
Date is corrected. New information added
from the main reference
Last corrections have been done.
SD: Small correction in the REACTION code
in Subent 006. ERR-ANALYS update in Subents 002-006.
ERR-HL -> ERR-16. Two refs moved to REL-REF. STATUS
'COREL' deleted (info moved to REL-REF).
A.Pavlik, G.Winkler, M.Uhl
A.Paulsen., H.Liskien.
Main reference for Ni-58 data.

0.free_text: Sum of the N,N+P,      N,P+N and N,D reactions

free_txt: 12.7 cm * 12.7 cm NaI(Tl)  detector to
measure Ni-57, Co-57, Co-58g, Na-24 gamma activity
Does not include the error of the
given average energy.
Uncertainty in counting statistics
Uncertainty due to isotopic content
Uncertainty in the half-life of the
reaction product
Center of the neutron energy line
displacement
.Error matrices are given in tables 5,6.
T(d,n)He-4 reaction.
IRK;   air-jet-cooled solid state Ti-T target.
Geel;  solid state target of tritium occluded in
a 3.9 mg/cm**2 Y-layer on a 0.5 mm Cu-backing.
Details of
the experiment and analysis; data for Zr-90(n,2n)
Thesis,  University of
Vienna. Experimental details.
To detect the recoil protons used
at the CBNM
.The principal sources of uncertainty were
ERROR due to the irradiation geometry of
the sample
Error due to the sample mass including purity
Error due to the detector efficiency
Max error due to the half-life of
interfering Co-57
Max error due to the half-life of
interfering Co-58g
Error due to the irradiation time, dead time
Error due to the differential T(d,n)He4
cross section
Error due to fluence determination with
proton recoil telescope
Error due to correction for absorption and
scattering by sample holder ring and samples
between source and telescope
Error due to correction for neutron
absorption in target backing (forward hemisphere)
Error due to correction for neutron
absorption in beam-line (backward hemisphere)
Error due to correction for neutron
scattering effects in target backing
Error due to correction for absorption,
scattering and backscattering by samples and
sample holder ring
Error due to correction for relating the
measured cross section to the averaged neutron
energy
7 MV Van de Graaff accelerator of GEEL.
For the energy range 12.3 to 19.5 MeV.
Energy steps 0.2 to 0.8 MeV.
Single target irradiation
Recoil particle method
.Natural Ni, purity > 99.98%
.Samples were fastened to the inner side of a 1 mm
thick  aluminum ring 20 cm in  diam. with the target
in the centre, arranged in steps of 6 and 12 degr.
symmetric to the direction of the deuteron beam.
Tbl.III from 82ANTWERP,440 and
Tbl.III from NSE,90,186,1985 (the same results)
with 27Al(n,a)24Na monitor (Vienna)
.The datum at E = 14.690 MeV resulted from a
measurement at the Van de Graaff accelerator/CBNM.
Li-I(Eu) scintillation detector for the time
distribution of the neutron production
.The principal sources of uncertainty were
Error due to masses for sample and
reference including purity
Error due to the detector efficiency for
sample radiation
Error due to the detector efficiency for
Na-24  radiation
Error due to the half-life of interfering
Co-57
Error due to the half-life of interfering
Co-58-g
Max error due to half-life of Na-24
Error due to flux gradient in sample
(experimentally determined)
Error due to correction for elastic
neutron scattering by samples and sample holder
Error raised from correction for
neutron scattering effects due to target backing
Error due to room return background
Error due to correction for relating the
measured cross section to the average
neutron energy
27-Al(N,A)Na-24 reference cross section
error
IRK accelerator for the energy range
13.4 to 14.8 MeV, energy steps 0.04 to 0.15 MeV.
Irradiation at Geel - CBNM
Stack target irradiation
Cross section data
taken from evaluation by Tagesen and Vonach,
Physics Data 13-1,1981, Fachinformationszentrum
Karlsruhe.
.Natural Ni, purity > 99.98%
.Each sample was packed together either with two or
at least one aluminum foil for monitoring.
Tbl.III from 82ANTWERP,440 and
Tbl.IV from NSE,90,186,1985 (the same results)
with proton recoil telescope (Geel)
To detect the recoil protons used
at the CBNM
.The principal sources of uncertainty were
ERROR due to the irradiation geometry of
THE sample
Error due to the sample mass including purity
Error due to the detector efficiency

cross section

Error due to correction for neutron

Error due to correction for absorption,

7 MV Van de Graaff accelerator of GEEL.
For the energy range 12.3 to 19.5 MeV.

Single target irradiation
Recoil particle method
.Natural Ni, purity > 99.98%
.Samples were fastened to the inner side of a 1 mm
thick aluminum ring 20 cm in diam. with the target in
the centre, arranged in steps of 6 and 12 degr.
symmetric to the direction of the deuteron beam.
Tbl.III from NSE,90,186,1985
with 27Al(n,a)24Na monitor (Vienna)
.The datum at e = 14.690 MeV resulted from a
measurement at the Van de Graaff accelerator/CBNM.
Li-I(Eu) scintillation detector for the time
distribution of the neutron production
.The principal sources of uncertainty were
Error due to masses for sample and
reference including purity
Error due to the detector efficiency for
sample radiation
